statement.tex: \text{If the function }\\ \quad f(x) = 2x^3-9mx^2 + 12m^2x + 1,\\ \text{where }m\gt 0\text{ attains its maximum and}\\ \text{minimum values at p and q respectively}\\ \text{such that }p^2 = q,\text{ then find the value of }m.
\\ \textbf{At p and q}\\ \text{We don't know what the values of p}\\ \text{and q are. But nevertheless, would the}\\ \text{following be true at p and q?}
\\ \text{Your friend makes the following claim.}\\ \text{Is his claim right or wrong?}
\\ \textbf{Value of m}\\ \text{Given that maxima is at }x=m\text{ and }\\ \text{minima at }x = 2m,\text{ m equals the following.}\\ \textbf{Right or wrong?}

reason.tex:
\dfrac{dy}{dx} = 0\text{ will only tell you which points}\\ \text{could be maxima or minima. But it}\\ \text{wouldn't tell you what exactly they are.}\\ \text{For that you need to see }\dfrac{d^2y}{dx^2}.\\
\begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|l|} \hline & \frac{d}{dx}f(x) & \frac{d^2}{dx^2}f(x) & \text{Why?} \\ \hline p & 0 & \lt 0 & \text{Maxima} \\ \hline q & 0 & \gt 0 & \text{Minima}\\ \hline \end{tabular} \\ \textbf{Note: }\frac{dy}{dx} = 0\text{ is no guarantee that}\\ \text{the point is a maxima or minima. It could}\\ \text{be neither. Think }x = 0\text{ in } y = x^3.

\text{Find }\dfrac{d^2y}{dx^2}\text{ to know the nature}\\ \text{of the extrema (maxima or minima).} \\ \begin{align} \dfrac{df(x)}{dx} &= 6\cdot(x^2 - 3mx + 2m) \\ \implies \dfrac{d^2 y}{dx^2} &= 6\cdot (2x - 3m) \end{align} \\ \textbf{Remember, }\text{ we already have two}\\ \text{candidate points, }x=m\text{ and } x=2m. \\
\begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|} \hline &\text{Condition} &\text{Only if}\ldots \\ \hline \text{Maxima} & 2x - 3m\lt 0 & x = m\\ \hline \text{Minima} & 2x-3m\gt 0 & x = 2m \\ \hline \end{tabular}

\begin{align} \text{Maxima } &= p = m \\ \text{Minima } &= q = p^2 = 2m \\ \implies m^2 &= 2m \implies m\cdot (m-2) = 0 \\ \implies m &=0,2 \end{align} \\ \text{But }m \gt 0.\text{Therefore, only }m=2\text{ is}\\ \text{an acceptable solution.}
